ygData.subject: Re: Levels after hell levels
ygData.msgSnippet: ... You have it backwards, but yes. When I died at 47, I only lost a half bubble into 46.  All my friends who died at 46 said they lost over a bubble. That
ygData.messageBody:
On Wed, 23 Feb 2000, Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4 wrote:
>
> I think I see what you were saying now. When I died at 30th level, the EXP
> bar didn't drop very much. I still lost the same amount of EXP I did when I
> died at 29-, it just wasn't as noticeable because it takes so much extra EXP
> to get thru those levels. When you died at 47 and dropped to 46, your EXP
> bar decreased a full bubble into 46. Had you died at 46 with only a few
> pixels to go before making 47th, you would only have lost maybe a 1/4
> bub(normal EXP loss). So in effect, when you died at 47 and dropped a full
> bub into 46, you got penalized more than you should have. Is that what you
> were pointing out?

You have it backwards, but yes.

When I died at 47, I only lost a half bubble into 46. All my
friends who died at 46 said they lost over a bubble. That
indicates the exp loss at 47 is less than the exp loss at 46.

When I died at 31, I lost a half bubble into 30. When I died
at 30, I lost a quarter bubble. That indicates the exp loss
at 31 is more than the exp loss at 30.

Both of these indicate the exp loss at (hell level+1) is
greater than at other levels.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
